benchmark_details.name: Synthetic Dataset Generation for Self-Disclosure Detection
benchmark_details.overview: This paper develops a synthetic, PII-labeled multi-text span dataset generated from large language models to foster reproducible research into personally identifiable information (PII) detection in vulnerable populations.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a privacy-preserving synthetic dataset for training models to detect self-disclosure of personally identifiable information (PII).

data.source: Synthetic data generated from real posts on Reddit, focusing on vulnerable populations.
data.annotation: Annotated for PII-revealing spans by domain experts

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on model performance comparisons on synthetic vs. original datasets.
methodology.interpretation: A higher F1 Score and accuracy indicates better performance and usefulness of synthetic data.
methodology.baseline_results: Performance metrics of the multilabel classifier on synthetic datasets are comparable to those on the original dataset.
methodology.validation: Validated through user studies measuring indistinguishability and replicability of results.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: The dataset is synthetic and designed not to be linkable to original users' data.
